summary: The federal response to COVID-19 led to unprecedented spending. Treasury quickly sold securities to raise $3.8 trillion. Meanwhile, Treasury increased its cash-on-hand to over $1 trillion to help deal with the uncertainty around federal pandemic-related spending. Changes in the amount of cash that Treasury keeps on hand can affect investor demand for Treasury securities—so we recommended Treasury clarify its policy and communicate more clearly about...
title: Federal Debt Management: Treasury Quickly Financed Historic Government Response to the Pandemic and is assessing Risks to Market Functioning
